required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tacrolimus Adjustment by NFAT-related Gene Expression in Lung Allograft Recipients.
clinical_study.official_title: Tacrolimus Adjustment by NFAT-related Gene Expression in Lung Allograft Recipients.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a non-interventional cohort study to assess a novel assay to detect excessive or insufficient immunosuppression from the drug tacrolimus in lung transplant recipients. The assay measures mean residual expression (MRE) of genes downstream of nuclear factor of activated T cells (NFAT), a transcription factor regulated by tacrolimus. The investigators will assess whether MRE levels identify subjects at risk for rejection (insufficient immunosuppression) or infection (excessive immunosuppression).

primary_outcome.measure: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Acute Cellular Rejection
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant
primary_outcome.description: The prescribed tacrolimus dosage was determined by the treating physician who was not aware of the study-assay values. For the study assay, two blood draws were collected at a study visit during the assessment period (from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant). The first draw occurred before tacrolimus dosage (trough) and the second occurred 90 to 120 minutes after tacrolimus dosage (peak). To determine MRE, whole blood was stimulated, RNA was extracted, and residual expression of NFAT-related cytokines (NFAT: nuclear factor of activated T-cells) was determined by quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR). Researchers stratified blood draws based on subject's rejection pathology at time of blood draw and observed percentage distribution of MRE values within each rejection pathology group. Observed differences between MRE distributions within non-rejection group and rejection groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Infection
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant
primary_outcome.description: Researchers stratified blood draws based on subject's airway infection status at time of blood draw (based on biopsy results) and observed percentage distribution of MRE values within each infection status group. Researchers observed differences between MRE distributions within subjects with airway infection at time of blood draw and subjects with no infection diagnosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Weeks Post-Transplant
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 month (4 weeks) up to 18 months (82 weeks) post-transplant
secondary_outcome.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values at time of blood draw from study visits at 4 weeks post-transplant up to 82 weeks post-transplant. Researchers observed association between percentage of MRE at time of blood draw and the number of weeks post-transplant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Tacrolimus Trough Level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant
secondary_outcome.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values on the day of blood draws. Researchers measured tacrolimus concentration in blood drawn before tacrolimus dosage (trough) and observed the association between percentage of MRE on the day of blood draw and tacrolimus trough level.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Medication Dosages
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant
secondary_outcome.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values on the day of blood draws and measured tacrolimus, prednisone, and mycophenolate dose at the time of blood draw. Researchers observed the association between percentage of MRE on the day of blood draw and tacrolimus, prednisone, and mycophenolate dose, respectively, at the time of blood draw.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
The study will include lung allograft recipients within 2 months of transplantation at UCSF.
Exclusion criteria:
Subjects will be excluded who are (a) unable to provide consent or (b) if treating clinicians do not anticipate subject will start on tacrolimus. Recruitment and enrollment in this study are targeted equally between women and minorities and the study will not exclude any gender or racial/ethnic group. This study does not involve vulnerable populations.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Lung transplant recipients treated at UCSF with tacrolimus-based immunosuppressive regimen recruited one to two months post-transplant.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants followed for 6 to 18 months post transplantation. Study visits performed within one day of a clinical bronchoscopy scheduled either for cause, such as suspected infection or rejection, or for surveillance at 2, 3, 6, 12, or 18 months.

group.title: Lung Transplant Participants
group.description: Lung transplant participants treated at UCSF with tacrolimus-based immunosuppression were followed until 18 months post-transplant, or until the participant’s death or withdrawal.

participants_list.participants: The number of biopsy procedures performed during the time the patient was enrolled in the study.
The number of biopsy samples assayed during the time the patient was enrolled in the study.

group.title: Lung Transplant Participants
group.description: Lung transplant participants treated at UCSF with tacrolimus-based immunosuppression were followed until 18 months post-transplant, or until the participant’s death or withdrawal.

outcome.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Acute Cellular Rejection
outcome.description: The prescribed tacrolimus dosage was determined by the treating physician who was not aware of the study-assay values. For the study assay, two blood draws were collected at a study visit during the assessment period (from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant). The first draw occurred before tacrolimus dosage (trough) and the second occurred 90 to 120 minutes after tacrolimus dosage (peak). To determine MRE, whole blood was stimulated, RNA was extracted, and residual expression of NFAT-related cytokines (NFAT: nuclear factor of activated T-cells) was determined by quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR). Researchers stratified blood draws based on subject's rejection pathology at time of blood draw and observed percentage distribution of MRE values within each rejection pathology group. Observed differences between MRE distributions within non-rejection group and rejection groups.
outcome.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant
outcome.population: Number of participants' study visits analyzed determined by the availability and quality of samples at both time points.

group.title: Non-rejection
group.description: Blood draw samples collected at the time of bronchoscopy with biopsy. Samples included if both time points (before tacrolimus dose and 90 to 120 minutes after dose) were collected, samples provided good quality RNA, and the patient had no evidence of acute cellular rejection. Acute cellular rejection was determined based on clinical interpretation of transbronchial biopsy specimens and graded according to International Society of Heart and Lung Transplantation (ISHLT) guidelines, with non-rejection defined as “A0B0.”

group.title: Rejection
group.description: Transbronchial biopsy showing A>0 or B>0 pathology with no rejection defined as A = 0 in perivascular interstitial components of the lung and B = 0 in airway components of the lung.

measure.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Acute Cellular Rejection
measure.description: The prescribed tacrolimus dosage was determined by the treating physician who was not aware of the study-assay values. For the study assay, two blood draws were collected at a study visit during the assessment period (from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant). The first draw occurred before tacrolimus dosage (trough) and the second occurred 90 to 120 minutes after tacrolimus dosage (peak). To determine MRE, whole blood was stimulated, RNA was extracted, and residual expression of NFAT-related cytokines (NFAT: nuclear factor of activated T-cells) was determined by quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR). Researchers stratified blood draws based on subject's rejection pathology at time of blood draw and observed percentage distribution of MRE values within each rejection pathology group. Observed differences between MRE distributions within non-rejection group and rejection groups.
measure.population: Number of participants' study visits analyzed determined by the availability and quality of samples at both time points.

outcome.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Infection
outcome.description: Researchers stratified blood draws based on subject's airway infection status at time of blood draw (based on biopsy results) and observed percentage distribution of MRE values within each infection status group. Researchers observed differences between MRE distributions within subjects with airway infection at time of blood draw and subjects with no infection diagnosis.
outcome.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant

group.title: Non-Infection
group.description: No airway infection as defined by presence of pathogenic species on bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) culture and at least one of the following: semi-quantitative cultures with at least moderate quantity, CT findings, or symptoms consistent with acute infection.

group.title: Infection
group.description: Airway infection defined by presence of pathogenic species on BAL culture and at least one of the following: semi-quantitative cultures with at least moderate quantity, CT findings, or symptoms consistent with acute infection.

measure.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Infection
measure.description: Researchers stratified blood draws based on subject's airway infection status at time of blood draw (based on biopsy results) and observed percentage distribution of MRE values within each infection status group. Researchers observed differences between MRE distributions within subjects with airway infection at time of blood draw and subjects with no infection diagnosis.

outcome.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Weeks Post-Transplant
outcome.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values at time of blood draw from study visits at 4 weeks post-transplant up to 82 weeks post-transplant. Researchers observed association between percentage of MRE at time of blood draw and the number of weeks post-transplant.
outcome.time_frame: from 1 month (4 weeks) up to 18 months (82 weeks) post-transplant

group.title: Lung Transplant Participants
group.description: Time post-transplant determined by the number of weeks between the transplant date and the date of the blood draw. Outcome measures how mean residual expression values as a function of time post-transplant.

measure.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Weeks Post-Transplant
measure.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values at time of blood draw from study visits at 4 weeks post-transplant up to 82 weeks post-transplant. Researchers observed association between percentage of MRE at time of blood draw and the number of weeks post-transplant.

outcome.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Tacrolimus Trough Level
outcome.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values on the day of blood draws. Researchers measured tacrolimus concentration in blood drawn before tacrolimus dosage (trough) and observed the association between percentage of MRE on the day of blood draw and tacrolimus trough level.
outcome.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant

group.title: Lung Transplant Participants
group.description: Lung transplant participants treated at UCSF with tacrolimus-based immunosuppression were followed until 18 months post-transplant, or until the participant’s death or withdrawal. Tacrolimus trough levels were assayed on whole blood by the clinical lab using the Architect Immunoassay. The tacrolimus trough value closest in time to the study visit used.

measure.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Tacrolimus Trough Level
measure.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values on the day of blood draws. Researchers measured tacrolimus concentration in blood drawn before tacrolimus dosage (trough) and observed the association between percentage of MRE on the day of blood draw and tacrolimus trough level.

outcome.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Medication Dosages
outcome.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values on the day of blood draws and measured tacrolimus, prednisone, and mycophenolate dose at the time of blood draw. Researchers observed the association between percentage of MRE on the day of blood draw and tacrolimus, prednisone, and mycophenolate dose, respectively, at the time of blood draw.
outcome.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant

group.title: Lung Transplant Participants
group.description: Lung transplant participants treated at UCSF with tacrolimus-based immunosuppression were followed until 18 months post-transplant, or until the participant’s death or withdrawal. Tacrolimus, prednisone, and mycophenolate dose abstracted from medical charts at the time of blood draw.

measure.title: Association of Percentage of Mean Residual Expression (MRE%) of NFAT-related Cytokine Expression and Medication Dosages
measure.description: Researchers observed percentage distribution of MRE values on the day of blood draws and measured tacrolimus, prednisone, and mycophenolate dose at the time of blood draw. Researchers observed the association between percentage of MRE on the day of blood draw and tacrolimus, prednisone, and mycophenolate dose, respectively, at the time of blood draw.

reported_events.time_frame: from 1 month up to 18 months post-transplant

group.title: Lung Transplant Participants
group.description: Lung transplant participants treated at UCSF with tacrolimus-based immunosuppression were followed until 18 months post-transplant, or until the participant’s death or withdrawal.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Higher than expected variance in MRE and missed study visits somewhat reduced statistical power.
